title: Duplicate Emails
markdown:
# **Duplicate Emails**

## Write a SQL query to find all duplicate emails in a table named Person.

### Table Schema
| Column | Type |
|--------|------|
| id     | INT  |
| email  | TEXT |

### Example

**Input:**
```
**Person**
+----+---------+
| id | email   |
+----+---------+
| 1  | a@b.com |
| 2  | c@d.com |
| 3  | a@b.com |
+----+---------+
```

**Expected Output:**
```
+---------+
| email   |
+---------+
| a@b.com |
+---------+
```

testCases.setupSql: CREATE TABLE Person(id INT, email TEXT); INSERT INTO Person VALUES (1,'a@b.com'),(2,'c@d.com'),(3,'a@b.com');
testCases.solutionSql: SELECT email FROM Person GROUP BY email HAVING COUNT(email) > 1;

testCases.setupSql: CREATE TABLE Person(id INT, email TEXT); INSERT INTO Person VALUES (1,'a@b.com'),(2,'c@d.com');
testCases.solutionSql: SELECT email FROM Person GROUP BY email HAVING COUNT(email) > 1;

testCases.setupSql: CREATE TABLE Person(id INT, email TEXT); INSERT INTO Person VALUES (1,'a@b.com'),(2,'a@b.com'),(3,'a@b.com');
testCases.solutionSql: SELECT email FROM Person GROUP BY email HAVING COUNT(email) > 1;

testCases.setupSql: CREATE TABLE Person(id INT, email TEXT);
testCases.solutionSql: SELECT email FROM Person GROUP BY email HAVING COUNT(email) > 1;
